title: Getting Started with Next.js
content: Next.js is a powerful React framework that enables functionality such as server-side rendering and generating static websites. It provides an excellent developer experience with features like hot reloading, automatic code splitting, and optimized performance out of the box.

title: Understanding Static Site Generation
content: Static Site Generation (SSG) is a method where pages are pre-rendered at build time. This results in blazing fast load times and excellent SEO. Next.js makes SSG incredibly easy with getStaticProps and getStaticPaths functions.

title: Server-Side Rendering Explained
content: Server-Side Rendering (SSR) generates HTML on each request. This is perfect for pages with frequently changing data or personalized content. Next.js handles SSR seamlessly with the getServerSideProps function.

title: API Routes in Next.js
content: Next.js allows you to build your API directly within your Next.js application. API routes provide a straightforward solution to building your API without needing a separate backend server. Simply create files in the pages/api directory.

title: Optimizing Images and Fonts
content: Next.js provides built-in components for optimizing images and fonts. The Image component automatically optimizes images for different device sizes and formats, while next/font allows you to self-host Google Fonts for better performance and privacy.

title: Deploying Next.js Applications
content: Deploying Next.js applications is straightforward with platforms like Vercel, which is the company behind Next.js. Vercel offers seamless integration, automatic deployments, and optimizations specifically for Next.js apps.
